Share.d:
This was originally meant to be an app, with the launch task being "Launch Task", but I have had no luck in exporting as an app lately. You should be able to yourself, just add an icon or you can just run the launch task manually.
Guide to xdcc install
Step 1: Download plugins
Termux
Termux:Tasker
Step2: Paste these into Termux

after install(hit y and enter if prompted about package versions)
termux-setup-storage; pkg upgrade -y && pkg install -y rust binutils python && pip install xdcc; mkdir -p ~/storage/shared/xdcc/progress ~/.termux/tasker/ && echo -e '#!/usr/bin/bash\nxdcc $1 send $2 | tee /storage/emulated/0/xdcc/progress/${1/|/.}-$2.txt' > ~/.termux/tasker/xdcc.sh

Action.label: set to %update hours between updates to batch txt

termux-setup-storage; mkdir -p ~/storage/shared/xdcc/progress ~/.termux/tasker/ && echo -e '#!/usr/bin/bash\nxdcc $1 send $2 | tee /storage/emulated/0/xdcc/progress/${1/|/.}-$2.txt' > ~/.termux/tasker/xdcc.sh; pkg upgrade -y && pkg install -y rust binutils python && pip install xdcc
This command must be run in Termux before downloading can be done! Termux:Tasker must be installed!
waits for half an hour before updating the bot txt

Action.Str: Quality - %quality,Bot - %bot,Batch Update Rate - %batch_update hrs,Bot Update Rate - %bot_update hrs,Change Download Directory,Reload Files
Batch parsing takes a while, this can speed up searching but can lead to inaccurate pack numbers
Bot parsing is quick, but re-downloading before every search is a pain...
Don't worry, they're all basically the same.

Action.label: I am not very creative at naming lol
